metadata.case_name: Dr. Mohammad Saeed v. Custodian of Evacuee Property
metadata.case_number: Civil Appeal No. 456 of 1958; Petition No. 87 of 1961

facts.text: On April 1, 1950, the Deputy Custodian, Jaipur, made an order under s. 19 of the Administration of Evacuee Property Ordinance declaring the appellant Dr. Mohammad Saeed an intending evacuee.
Notice issued to respondent to show cause why he should not be declared evacuee under s. 2(d)(i) and s. 2(d)(iii) of the Ordinance.

Administration of Evacuee Property Act, 1950 (Act XXXI of 1950) came into force; notice issued to appellant under s. 22(b) to show cause why his property should not be declared evacuee property on ground of transfer of substantial portion of assets to Pakistan.
Dr. Mohammad Saeed transferred a substantial portion of his assets to Pakistan between November 1947 and September 1948.

On November 16, 1951, Deputy Custodian, Jaipur held Dr. Mohammad Saeed to be an evacuee under s. 2(d)(iii) of the Administration of Evacuee Property Ordinance, 1949, and his property evacuee property under s. 7 of the Ordinance and s. 22(b) of the Act.

On appeal, District Judge, Jaipur set aside declaration as evacuee under s. 2(d)(iii) and remanded for fresh decision; agreed on transfer under s. 22(b) but set aside order as other circumstances post-October 18, 1949 needed to be considered.
Custodian of Evacuee Property, Rajasthan moved Custodian-General for revision; Deputy Custodian-General referred to High Court under s. 27(2) of the Act.

Rajasthan High Court (Jaipur Bench) on May 10, 1957 in D.B. Civil Reference No. 17 of 1956: rejected contention that transfers post-declaration only relevant; held transfer August 14, 1947 to October 18, 1949 constituted preparation for migration; set aside District Judge's order on s. 22(b) and directed Custodian-General/Deputy to dispose accordingly.
On August 10, 1957, Deputy Custodian-General held property rightly declared evacuee under s. 22(b).
Appeal by special leave: Civil Appeal No. 456 of 1958.
Petition under Art. 32 filed February 14, 1961 praying for writ of certiorari/mandamus to quash order under s. 22(b).
Appeal heard in part on January 23, 1961, adjourned to enable writ petition.

legal_issues.text: Whether s. 22(b) of the Administration of Evacuee Property Act, 1950 contravenes Art. 14 of the Constitution.
Whether transfer of substantial assets to Pakistan before declaration as intending evacuee can be considered under s. 22(b).
Whether other circumstances beyond substantial transfer, including post-October 18, 1949 conduct, must be considered under s. 22(b).

petitioner_arguments.text: S. 22(b) contravenes Art. 14 by discriminating between intending evacuees (transfers pre-October 18, 1949) who get no restoration under s. 16 or compensation under s. 13 of 1954 Act, and evacuees (post-1949 transfers under s. 2(d)(iv)) who do.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Art. 14; s. 2(d)(iv), s. 16 Admin. Evacuee Property Act 1950; s. 13 Displaced Persons Compensation Act 1954

petitioner_arguments.text: Transfer of substantial assets before declaration as intending evacuee cannot be considered under s. 22(b).
Custodian must consider other circumstances including conduct after October 18, 1949 before declaring property evacuee under s. 22(b).

respondent_arguments.text: Transfer of substantial portion of assets to Pakistan between August 14, 1947 and October 18, 1949 constitutes preparation for migration justifying declaration under s. 22(b); circumstances need not post-date declaration.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s. 22(b) and Explanation, Admin. Evacuee Property Act 1950

court_reasoning.text: Persons transferring assets pre-October 18, 1949 and post are not similarly circumstanced due to political context; distinct classes justify different treatment; discrimination not from s. 22(b) but omission to extend benefits to intending evacuees.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Two groups not similarly circumstanced; denial of benefits not infringement of Art. 14.

court_reasoning.text: Language of s. 22(b) allows consideration of pre-declaration transfers of substantial assets as prescribed circumstance; no requirement for post-declaration acts.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Transfer before declaration relates to the person declared intending evacuee.

court_reasoning.text: Substantial transfer alone sufficient as prescribed circumstance; no need to consider other circumstances where authority exercised on that basis.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Custodian's declaration proper on facts proved.

holdings.text: Transfer of substantial assets pre-declaration as intending evacuee can be basis for s. 22(b) declaration.
On facts, property rightly declared evacuee under s. 22(b); High Court order upheld.

outcome.summary: Petition under Art. 32 dismissed with costs as s. 22(b) held not violative of Art. 14; appeal dismissed upholding declaration of property as evacuee property under s. 22(b) based on pre-declaration substantial asset transfer to Pakistan.

key_quotes.text: "the transfer to Pakistan of a substantial portion of the assets shall be deemed to be one of the circumstances prescribed under clause (b) irrespective of whether the transfer took place before the declaration as intending evacuee was made or after such declaration."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets s. 22(b) to allow pre-declaration transfers

key_quotes.text: "Persons who had transferred assets between the 14th August, 1947, and the 18th October, 1949, may therefore reasonably have been considered by the legislature to form a class distinct... from those who transferred assets after the 18th October, 1949."
key_quotes.speaker: court
